greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A(n,k) is the sum over all Dyck paths of semilength n of products over all peaks p of (x_p+k*y_p)/y_p, where x_p and y_p are the coordinates of peak p; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: A Dyck path of semilength n is a (x,y)-lattice path from (0,0) to (2n,0) that does not go below the x-axis and consists of steps U=(1,1) and D=(1,-1). A peak of a Dyck path is any lattice point visited between two consecutive steps UD.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(x, y, t, k) option remember; `if`(y>x or y<0, 0,
mathematica: b[x_, y_, t_, k_] := b[x, y, t, k] = If[y>x || y<0, 0, If[x==0, 1, b[x-1, y -1, False, k]*If[t, (x+k*y)/y, 1] + b[x-1, y+1, True, k]]]; A[n_, k_] := b[2*n, 0, False, k]; Table[A[n, d-n], {d, 0, 12}, {n, 0, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 09 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, May 23 2015
